attributes.action: renegotiate the iniquitous terms of the loan being imposed on Icelandic people to repay the money lost by depositors in “Icesave”.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The legal and moral position is unclear, and one could spent hours arguing the rights and wrongs. In practical terms it’s a situation which can only be resolved by negotiation or mediation. 

However, the negotiations have been an unequal contest, and what has happened is that the Government of a tiny country of less than 400,000 people has been bullied by its neighbours, especially the UK and the Netherlands.

Consider what it would mean for us (increasing the sums of money at stake to reflect our far greater population). We would be proposing to repay a £700 billion loan. We would be suggesting that we should divert 10% of our taxes from public expenditure to repaying debt.

We would not accept it, and neither should it be imposed on the people of Iceland.
